Define magnetization. State its SI unit and dimensions. (Board 2024)
answer: Magnetization is the net magnetic dipole moment per unit volume of a material. Its SI unit is Amperes per meter (A/m) and its dimensions are $[L^{-1}M^0I^1]$.

text: Distinguish between diamagnetic and paramagnetic substances. (Board 2019)
answer: Diamagnetic substances are feebly repelled by a magnetic field and have negative magnetic susceptibility. Paramagnetic substances are feebly attracted by a magnetic field and have small positive magnetic susceptibility.
Magnetic hysteresis is the lagging of intensity of magnetization (M) behind the magnetic field intensity (H) when a magnetic material is subjected to a cycle of magnetization and demagnetization.

text: Explain the origin of magnetism in materials on the basis of electron theory. (Board 2018)
answer: According to the electron theory of magnetism, the magnetic moment of an atom arises from two sources: the orbital motion of electrons around the nucleus, which is equivalent to a current loop, and the intrinsic spin of the electrons, which also gives rise to a magnetic moment. The net magnetic moment of an atom is the vector sum of these orbital and spin magnetic moments.

text: An iron rod of cross-sectional area 0.1 m$^2$ is subjected to a magnetizing field of 1200 A/m. If the susceptibility of iron is 599, calculate the magnetic permeability and the magnetic flux produced. ($\mu_0 = 4\pi \times 10^{-7}$ SI units) (Textbook Numerical)
answer: Magnetic permeability $\mu = \mu_0(1 + \chi) = (4\pi \times 10^{-7})(1 + 599) = 4\pi \times 10^{-7} \times 600 \approx 7.54 \times 10^{-4}$ TÂ·m/A. Magnetic induction $B = \mu H = (7.54 \times 10^{-4}) \times 1200 = 0.9048$ T. Magnetic flux $\Phi = B \times A = 0.9048 \times 0.1 = 0.09048$ Wb.
